result.execSummary:
Casey Jeffrey Heitzmann was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Casey Jeffrey Heitzmann was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Casey Jeffrey Heitzmann

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: signed by EJL and Defendant this date. eif

CO: EJL, RPR: Val Deiss, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:   Michael E. Nieskes,  DF ATTY:  John A. Kucinski,  DF:  Casey Jeffrey Heitzmann appeared from jail.  Defendant has a felony warrant out of Minnesota. ADA McKinley would like bond amended to $5000.00 cash bond on 14CF212  to hold him until Tuesday 7/29/14 MH. Atty Kucinski argues amendment to bond would like it to remain. He also states he would waive time limits on MH. Bond continues. Court continues hearing from 7/29/14. Defendant signs WOE. Bond continues.
